data.title: Upmarket Mexican
data.text:
This is definitely a more up market place than many other Mexican restaurants, and accordingly the price is higher. A family of 3 adults and 2 kids under 10 were out of pocket by around $100 with only a couple of beers, no appetizers, with 3 adult meals and 2 kids meals.

The patio is under cover and enclosed and stayed warm even though outside was most definitely cold. Funky lighting effects - interesting without being distracting.

No drinks menu: telling me there is a "full bar" and then me reeling off a load of drinks they don't have, and then the server trying to remember what beers they had, is not really a productive way of getting me to drink your products. Just print a menu for goodness' sake! Who knows, maybe you had some premium stuff that I would have liked, and you would have liked to have sold, but nobody knew it existed!

My pollo mole was only tepid when it came out. Though all the food arrived at the table together, I suspect mine had been left on the side while others were still cooking. "Taco Tuesday" involved a good selection of condiments to go with the meat... but a long wait to actually get a taco. Good enough taste though.

Nice place but a few niggles.

data.title: lovebugs5
data.text: Not a good place to eat the prices are extremely high and long wait for service. Not impressed with their food at all I would say Taco Bell is a lot better

data.title: very nice place
data.text: nice place to take family or friends..service is good as is the food,,, nice place to go for a birthday or just to have a nice dinner...

data.title: the food is good but very expensive.
data.text: the food is good, but over priced.  I have only been here a couple of times.  It is just too expensive for Mexican food.  the staff is always friendly and the restaurant is always clean.

data.title: Quick Dinner
data.text: Very pricey for the area... owners/staff seem very nice..  waitress was a little blah...   all platters were close to $18 or higher....tough to keep family outting affordable with this...   great patio area in back..very casual and airy... good guacamole...made fresh

data.title: Used to be a lot better
data.text: Not very friendly or attentive.  Food was so-so, not the best Mexican food in the high desert any more.  Decor is dated, fish tank dirty.  I had fajitas, mostly peppers, little meat.  They have lost us as customers.  Also put off that the parking close to the back entrance was full of staff cars, staff should park away from entrances.

data.title: Good Italian food ...
data.text: Nice and clean, which is the first thing I look for.  The menu even offers shrimp cocktail!  It's a meal in itself!

data.title: Recommended by family member who lives in Apple Valley
data.text: Greeted warmly by the bartender upon arrival. Waitstaff hadn't quite arrived yet since We were very early for dinner .   my husband ordered the Chicken Chimichanga, I ordered the chili Rellanyo and Cheese enchilada, and my cousin ordered the Tamale and Chili . Rellanyo. Everyone enjoyed their dinners with left overs to spare.  The bartender then sent over a huge Fried Ice Cream Ball with chocolate sauce. Margueritas were delicious and well made.

data.title: Best Mexican Food in High Desert
data.text: My wife and I eat here at least once or twice a week, Wednesday for sure. Start with world class blended Cadillac Margarita's, awesome and authentic chili verde, best fajitas. They also cook some of the best steaks in the high desert, prime rib, rib-eye, new york, porterhouse. We have tried just about  everything and its always been great. Service is beyond great, Gus, Linda, Brisa, Omar, Robert, Andrew, Maria Elena, Amy treat everyone like family and get to know you, it is really a great atmosphere, we love it. We just did our Christmas party here and they made it a great experience.

data.title: awesome enchiladas
data.text: Gus and his crew do a fabulous job of making each visit special.  The crab & shrimp enchiladas are fantastic!!

data.title: Great
data.text: Loved it there but they had the air conditioner on so low it was freezing inside, any food I have had there as been really good and great service

data.title: Time for a fiesta
data.text: Good Salsa and chips, and they make a mean margarita! The main dishes are okay, nothing special but will satisfy your desire for Mexican Food.

data.title: I would only eat outside if I go back
data.text: Food was good, service was ok.  Went at lunch time, no one was there.  I dont like the smell of eating places that have carpet.  So between the carpet and the fish tank, the place had an odor to me.

data.title: Tired Interior
data.text: I have lived in the high Desert 15 years and have tried this particular Restaurant several times...the first time I was less than impressed with the absent service and very tired interior and poorly presented food plates...BUT trying to be fair,  I again recently stopped in again to see if my experience was unjust.   the parking is in the rear and you enter thru what is suppose to be a court yard for dining, an area I would never consider eating at, and went into the lobby....again no person to greet you but to stand there waiting and waiting and waiting.....we walked out again....I wonder how many customers do this......and how many customers they lose .. I'll never know as I will never return....... .

data.title: Be sure to try their chile verde!
data.text: We had their chile relleno topped with chile verde, enchiladas, tacos, beans and rice, and thought everything was just delicious! You could tell everything was made from the freshest, highest quality ingredients. Their chips and salsa were outstanding.

data.title: Early closing make you lose customer
data.text: After driving over there and going into the restaurant we got inside at 8:47 pm and the sign say they close at 10 and even on the Internet say that too so we got this guy telling us I thing we close already and I say how the sign says you guys close at 10 he say it's a slow night tonight so we close lil early ... I think for a place got the number 1 review shouldn't close early and 2nd shouldn't be slow on Saturday night too ...

data.title: Simply the Best
data.text:
Many good food choices. The tableside, freshly made to order guacamole is the very best!
They are known for prime rib and I love their salmon or chicken with suiza sauce. 
If you are lucky, Gus may sing for you...gorgeous voice!

data.title: Very good food
data.text: Friendly people and the food is so good. I enjoy getting the tacos or enchiladas even fajitas. Can't miss out on the margaritas. Strawberry for me. Warm Chips and plenty of salsa. Dinner salads are very good too. I'm ready for some good Mexican food with my Strawberry Margaritas.

data.title: Very Good Mexican Food
data.text: The place is much bigger than it appears and a little hard to get to but, plenty of parking in the back. The atmosphere is nice and relaxing with very courteous service that is attentive to your every need. The food is very tasty with great flavors and is filling.

data.title: Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: Owners are originally from Mexico and bring their cooking heritage with them.  Everything is good but my favorite is Carnitas and really great Margaritas.  Do not leave till you have had Gus's Fried Ice Cream...unbelievably delicious
